title: remice
text: remice package provides tools help clean analyze datasets, especially related mice experiments. vignette provide additional examples functions. additional information functions data sets, refer README file.

title: remice
text: analyze_type used check whether values column (Body Weight 1) match specified type (numeric). analyze_type automatically fail column name exist data type inputted inaccurate Note fail find value “13.5” checking character values, 13.5 can cast character.
code: analyze_type(mouse_data_bw_dirty, "Body Weight 3", "numeric") analyze_type(mouse_data_bw_dirty, "Body Weight 1", "int") #> Error in analyze_type(mouse_data_bw_dirty, "Body Weight 1", "int"): The data_type needs to be one of "integer", "numeric", "boolean", or "character" analyze_type(mouse_data_bw_dirty, "Date", "integer") #> Error in analyze_type(mouse_data_bw_dirty, "Date", "integer"): Column "Date" not found in the data

title: remice
text: table_different function identifies strings appear less frequently column. Note function built character values, non-character columns produce error function adivsed used columns large amount differing values, results messy.
code: table_different(mouse_data_birth, "Treatment", frequency = 2) table_different(mouse_data_bw_clean, "Body Weight 1") #> Error in table_different(mouse_data_bw_clean, "Body Weight 1"): Column should be a string table_different(mouse_data_birth, "ID")

title: remice
text: multiple responses exist one row, use separate_list generate table common responses. example: , separate_list used character columns, non-character values provide error
code: separate_list(food_data, "comfort_food", min_frequency = 10) separate_list(mouse_data_bw_clean, "Body Weight 1") #> Error in separate_list(mouse_data_bw_clean, "Body Weight 1"): Column should be a string

title: remice
text: plot_outliers function visualizes rows unusually large changes based specified percent threshold. columns must numeric, rows NA values can either ignored give error.
code: plot_outliers(mouse_data_bw_clean, c("Body Weight 1", "Body Weight 2", "Body Weight 3"), threshold = 0.2) plot_outliers(mouse_data_bw_dirty, c("Body Weight 1", "Body Weight 2", "Body Weight 3")) #> Error in plot_outliers(mouse_data_bw_dirty, c("Body Weight 1", "Body Weight 2", : Column "Body Weight 1" is non-numeric

title: Authors and Citation
text: Eric Tong. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tong E (2025). remice: Tools Cleaning Mice Data. R package version 1.0.1, https://erictong2.github.io/remice, https://github.com/erictong2/remice.
code: @Manual{,   title = {remice: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data},   author = {Eric Tong},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.1, https://erictong2.github.io/remice},   url = {https://github.com/erictong2/remice}, }

title: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data
text: collaborators remiss data collection? experienced characters numeric columns? rows ever get incorrectly entered swapped? overarching goal remice package account remiss data, providing way identify solve problems.

title: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data
text: can install development version remice like : prefer, can also go Github website (https://github.com/EricTong2/remice/) download package .
code: install_github("erictong2/remice")

title: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data
text: functions included package: analyze_type() takes column characters determines values row specified type. directly fix types data, creates table highlight areas data cause errors functions, allowing rows manually fixed. table_different() takes column characters creates table strings uncommonly found dataset. aimed mitigate various typos found either entering data survey responses. example, column values “True” except single “Ture”, likely typo occurred. function fix problems, highlights row numbers data checked. separate_list() takes column characters creates table common responses multiple responses exist one row. example, two responses “Apple, Banana, Orange” “Banana, Orange”, output table “Apple: 1, Banana: 2, Orange: 2.” can used survey comfort foods, response might plot_outliers() takes multiple columns numeric data longitudinally collected checks abnormally large changes data. used check potential outliers areas data mis-input: example, recording “11” grams instead “21” grams. addition, user inputs percent change, points change greater input two points plotted graph.

title: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data
text: comfort_food list students’ comfort foods food_childhood list students’ childhood foods meals_dinner_friend list foods eaten friends came mouse_data_birth dataset 32 mice four columns, describing mouse ID, Sex, Number, Treatment type mouse_data_bw_dirty dataset 32 mice seven columns, first ID mouse_data_birth. six columns describe three dates data collected alternating Body Weight mouse Date Body Weight collected mouse_data_bw_clean provides information mouse_data_bw_dirty includes cleaned data provide examples functions.

title: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data
text: example separate_list() using Comfort Food column food_data example plot_outliers() using mouse_data_bw_clean dataset:
code: library(remice)  separate_list(food_data, "comfort_food", 5) library(remice)  table_different(mouse_data_birth, "Treatment", 5)

what: Analyze the Type of a Column — analyze_type
title: Analyze the Type of a Column — analyze_type
text: Takes column dataframe returns table shows rows able coerced specified type. includes entries NA.

title: Analyze the Type of a Column — analyze_type
code: analyze_type(data, col_name, data_type)

title: Analyze the Type of a Column — analyze_type
text: data name dataset working col_name name column dataset, expressed string data_type data type looking . one four strings: "integer", "numeric", "boolean", "character"

title: Analyze the Type of a Column — analyze_type
text: table displaying columns unable coerced chosen type

title: Analyze the Type of a Column — analyze_type
code: analyze_type(mouse_data_bw_dirty, "Body Weight 3", "numeric")     Rows that are not  numeric     Row Number       Value     31 Dead

text: dataset contains information regarding food students Mercyhurst University

code: food_data

title: Food Data — food_data
text: data frame 125 rows 3 variables: comfort_food Character, list comfort foods food_childhood Character, list childhood foods meals_dinner_friend Character, list foods eaten friends came

title: Food Data — food_data
text: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/borapajo/food-choices/versions/1/data

title: Plot Outliers — plot_outliers
text: function takes longitunal dataset finds unusually large percent changes datapoints row.

title: Plot Outliers — plot_outliers
code: plot_outliers(data, col_names, threshold = 0.2, ignore_NA = FALSE)

title: Plot Outliers — plot_outliers
text: data name dataset col_names vector column names threshold number representing percent change classify "outlier" (default .2, 20% change) ignore_NA boolean determining whether ignore NA values

title: Plot Outliers — plot_outliers
text: plot displaying outlier plotted graph

what: remice: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data — remice-package
title: remice: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data — remice-package
text: remice package provides tools cleaning analyzing datasets, including derived experiments involving mice.

title: remice: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data — remice-package
text: documentation package available package vignette. Run vignette("intro", package = "remice") see vignette.

title: remice: Tools for Cleaning Mice Data — remice-package
text: Maintainer: Eric Tong erictong@college.harvard.edu

title: Separate List — separate_list
text: function takes column dataset multiple responses row separates responses table

title: Separate List — separate_list
code: separate_list(   data,   col_name,   min_frequency = 1,   delimiter = c(", ", ", and", ",", " and ") )

title: Separate List — separate_list
text: data name dataset col_name name column, expressed string min_frequency minimum number times string needs occur appears table (Default 1) delimiter various words punctuation marks used separate strings, represented vector (Default c(", ", ", ",",", " "))

title: Separate List — separate_list
text: table representing common strings responses

title: Separate List — separate_list
code: separate_list(food_data, "comfort_food", 5)     Separated Word Frequencies     Word       Frequency     ice cream 45pizza 37chips 26chocolate 25cookies 17cheese 16mac 11pasta 9cake 7candy 7french fries 7popcorn 7pretzels 5

title: Analyze String Typos — table_different
text: Creates table rows different values rest rows.

title: Analyze String Typos — table_different
code: table_different(data, col_name, frequency = 5)

title: Analyze String Typos — table_different
text: data dataframe dataframe information col_name character name column frequency numeric maximum number times string can appear longer appears table

title: Analyze String Typos — table_different
text: Returns table list row numbers strings showed fewer number times frequency

title: Analyze String Typos — table_different
code: table_different(mouse_data_birth, "Treatment", 5)     Inconsistent Strings     Row Number       String     11 Placobo20 Trmt
